intro: Pleurothallis octavioi, commonly known as the Octavio's orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, often with intricate patterns on the petals. Its leaves are narrow and革质, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Due to its rarity and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many regions.
